medical_history.chief_complaint: Recurrent Clostridium difficile infection (CDI) associated with diarrhea.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Mr. S's current illness began when he was admitted with a urinary tract infection. Following treatment with ceftriaxone and ciprofloxacin, he developed diarrhea after discharge. He initially improved after a 10-day course of metronidazole, but continued to have 4 to 5 loose stools daily one month after discharge, accompanied by poor appetite, weight loss, fever, chills, and weakness. He was readmitted and tested positive for C difficile toxin. He has had several hospitalizations for diarrhea and was treated with oral vancomycin, which initially improved his condition but led to relapses. Currently, he experiences semiformed, soft stools once or twice a day.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, hypertensive renal disease with cadaveric renal transplantation in 1988 and again in 1998, spinal stenosis, urinary retention due to spinal stenosis and benign prostatic hypertrophy.
